result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Nmi Hinz

defendant.name: Hinz, Lisa Nmi
defendant.address: S4492 Belter Drive, North Freedom, WI 53951

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on December 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa Nmi Hinz in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE unclear why the petition was filed as she feels she's complied.  DE waives counsel.  State explains reason for today's hearing.  Motion to revoke DPA filed.  Court explains what motion states re: treatment documentation being provided to DA's office.  DE states she completed treatment in April.  Court suggests reset so DE can get that information from provider.  State suggests PTC be set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on November 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa Nmi Hinz in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE states she wishes to waive counsel.  Court questions DE re: counsel waiver/accepts.  State notes there is an agreement for a DPA in this matter.  DE agrees and enters NC plea.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and defers adjudication for 12 months on Ct 1.  Ct 2 is dismissed/read-in.  Review scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Lisa Nmi Hinz in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  State gives agreement reached, however no anger management assessment has been received.  Defendant advises court appointments have not be set due to insurance purposes.  Reset to complete the required assessment.  Court allows reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 08-14-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 08-26-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa Nmi Hinz in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Bond continued w/added conditions.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/T.H. and not to engage in violent or abusive conduct in front of either of her children (HLH and HBJH).  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
